intro: Uvaria marenteria f. acuta, commonly known as the sharp-fruited marentia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
